Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of the deficit that was inherited and the size of the surplus that was achieved.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the surplus is the largest in Virginia history.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the deficit was solely inherited from the previous governor, without considering external factors such as economic conditions.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge the possibility that the surplus may have been influenced by factors other than the actions of the current governor.
